poem:
The King's Dagger  

Tucked in his sock,  
a regal glint—  
King Charles strides  
through Scottish mist.  
Echoes of Macbeth?  
A gardener—tools in hand,  
halted by authority's gaze.  
Irony sharpens as  
steel sleeps, hidden.  
Royal privilege,  
a quiet companion  
to the quiet glen  
where the dagger  
does not judge.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Is this a dagger which I see before me, King Charles? | Brief letters I note that in the photo of King Charles visiting Scotland in your print edition (Monarch north of the glens, 29 July), he has a dagger tucked into his sock. How does this fit with the man arrested recently by armed police for carrying garden tools home from his allotment ? No doubt the king had armed police with him who took". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
